Taormina is a small port town on the east coast of the island of Sicily.
Known for its beautiful coastlines, architecture and its ‘simple yet exquisite’ cuisine.
The symbol of Sicily is the ‘Trinacria’, dishes of Sicilian origin are displayed by her presence.
The U.S. Food and Drug Administration’s Food Code permits service establishments to serve raw or undercooked foods at a consumer’s request understanding the risk involved;
“Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.”

September MENU
August 27th - September 28th
We are now serving an
Italian forward menu
, focusing on hand-made pastas prepared daily. We are now pleased to offer a seasonally rotating menu that changes monthly. We choose ingredients that highlight our dedication to artisanal craftsmanship. This evolving selection allows us to showcase the finest ingredients at their peak and to continually present our guests with something new and inspiring. For inquiries or additional information, please do not hesitate to contact us. We look forward to the opportunity to serve you.
Additional courses and supplements are available, but rotate based on ingredient availability.

About the Business
At Vintage Books, we’ve reimagined the speakeasy concept to offer a fresh, welcoming take on the classic idea. While we honor the vintage charm of the genre, we’ve created a bright, open space where exceptional food and craft cocktails take center stage. Our goal is to balance the sophistication of fine dining with the fun and playfulness of a speakeasy vibe—because who says great food and drinks can’t come with a little lighthearted mischief?

Whether you’re stopping in for a leisurely lunch with artisan sandwiches and light salads or enjoying our craft cocktails and small plates into the evening, Vintage Books is about creating moments that are both memorable and fun. Come and have fun with us—we can’t wait to welcome you!

Welcome to Ruscello, a delightful restaurant located at 1450 Ala Moana Blvd Ste 2950 in Honolulu, HI! At Ruscello, we serve up mouthwatering dishes made with the freshest ingredients and a touch of love. Our friendly staff is here to provide you with a memorable dining experience, whether you're joining us for a quick bite or a leisurely meal. Give us a call at (808) 953-6110 to make a reservation, or simply stop by to enjoy our cozy atmosphere and delicious food. We can't wait to welcome you to Ruscello!

About the Business
Located at the iconic Ilikai Hotel, Empire Steak House Hawaii brings the renowned dining experience of New York City to the heart of Honolulu. With a legacy of excellence, this restaurant is celebrated for its prime steaks, fresh seafood, and expertly crafted dishes that cater to discerning palates. Whether you’re looking for an intimate dinner, a celebratory gathering, or a venue for a memorable event, Empire Steak House offers a luxurious and welcoming atmosphere designed to elevate any occasion.

Guests can indulge in an extensive menu complemented by handcrafted cocktails, fine wines, and over 100 single malt scotches. The elegant setting features panoramic views of Honolulu’s breathtaking coastline, creating the perfect backdrop for an exceptional dining experience. From expertly prepared meals to impeccable service, every detail is designed to delight and impress.

Empire Steak House Hawaii blends the sophistication and quality of its New York roots with the warmth and charm of island hospitality. Whether you’re savoring a perfectly cooked steak, enjoying the finest seafood, or unwinding with a crafted cocktail, you’ll experience a seamless fusion of culinary excellence and aloha spirit. Visit Empire Steak House Hawaii to discover where timeless elegance meets the vibrant energy of paradise.

Haleiwa Joe’s in Kaneohe
In 2000, Haleiwa Joe’s opened a second location in Haiku Gardens on the windward side of Oahu. The open-air restaurant in this lush valley overlooks its own tropical garden and koi pond with a breathtaking view of the Ko‘olau mountain range.
Open for dinner nightly 4:00 - 9:00

M
eet
TEAM BASALT
✻
LANCE KOSAKA
Executive Chef
Chef Lance Kosaka joined the BASALT culinary team in April 2025. He was born in Honolulu and raised in Aiea, where he was influenced by his aunties on the importance of making good food for family gatherings.
ABOUT LANCE
Zoe Shinjo
SOUS CHEF
Zoe joined the BASALT culinary team in early 2025. She is a graduate of Le Cordon Bleu College of Culinary Arts Las Vegas.
ABOUT ZOE
TIM MILLER
SOUS CHEF
After a decade of honing his craft in the bustling kitchens of New York City's Highlands Restaurant Group, Tim brings his distinctive culinary style to Basalt.
ABOUT TIM
GLORIA CHAPARRO
JUNIOR SOUS CHEF
Born in El Paso, Texas, and raised in Juarez, Mexico, Gloria cites her mother as her biggest inspiration for her enthusiasm in the culinary arts – “she always cooked with so much love.”
ABOUT GLORIA
E
very Day is
Happy Hour
✻
Join us for Happy Hour from 2:00pm - 5:00pm daily, exclusively at the bar. Enjoy our signature handcrafted cocktails, beers on tap, and featured red and white wines at great prices. Savor our delicious appetizers that perfectly complement your happy hour cocktails.
Events
D
iscover
Our Story
✻
We believe that food brings people together, and our welcoming atmosphere reflects this belief. We aspire to be more than just as restaurant; we aim to be a gathering place for friends, family, and food enthusiasts.
MISSION STATEMENT
✻
Our Mission is to provide a pleasurable dining experience centered around Hawaii Regional cuisine - using locally sourced ingredients available - and to provide exceptional Aloha spirit service.
BASALT VALUES
✻
Supporting our local farmers and purveyors.
Empowering team members through culinary arts and showcasing their creative talents on our menus.
Welcoming our community into our establishment as family and bringing joy to every diner.
BASALT SIGNATURE CHARCOAL PANCAKES - DRY MIX

Located at the Rainbow Bazaar, Fresco is only accessible by stairs. Patrons unable to negotiate steps will be served on tables situated on the 1st Level of the Rainbow Bazaar, near the stairs leading up to the restaurant. Otherwise, customers may order from the Fresco menu at Tropics Bar & Grill and Bali Steak & Seafood.

a table
ABOUT EL CIELO
RESTAURANT CONCEPT
At El Cielo, we believe dining is more than a meal—it is an experience that connects cultures, traditions, and people. Opened in 2023 in the heart of Waikīkī, El Cielo is the vision of Chef Masa Arnaldo Gushiken, whose life journey from Argentina to Japan, Spain, and Hawai‘i inspires every dish on our menu.
Born in Buenos Aires to Okinawan-Japanese parents, Chef Masa’s culinary path has taken him across the globe—from training in Tokyo, to immersing himself in the flavors of Spain, to shaping Honolulu’s dining scene. His cooking blends the soul of Argentina, the discipline of Japan, and the vibrancy of Spain, creating a dining experience that is both authentic and uniquely personal.
El Cielo, meaning “the sky” or “heaven” in Spanish, reflects our philosophy: limitless creativity and the joy of sharing food that tells a story. Our menu celebrates the traditions of Spain with paellas, tapas, and pintxos, while weaving in subtle influences from Chef Masa’s multicultural heritage. Every plate is crafted with precision, passion, and heart.
Since opening, El Cielo has been recognized as one of Honolulu’s most exciting new restaurants, earning Best New Restaurant in the 2024 Hale ʻĀina Awards. More than accolades, however, our greatest honor is welcoming guests—locals and visitors alike—into our dining room to share in the warmth of hospitality and the celebration of flavor.
At El Cielo, we invite you to journey with us: to taste, to discover, and to savor the beauty of food without borders.

Reviews
Start stop reviews carousel
Review by - Google
five star review by
Han G:
We stumbled upon this restaurant and it turned out to be a hidden gem. It has a creative fusion of Japanese, Spanish, and Hawaiian influences. We loved every dish, especially the mushroom tapa and the charcuterie board. The ube basque cheesecake was just perfect!
Review by - Google
five star review by
Lucas L:
One of the best restaurants on Oahu, hands down! Fantastic food - we ordered pincho and tapas one after the other and kept the wine flowing. Service was wonderful, and each plate was better than the last! Recommend to anyone looking for a fine dining experience with no arrogance!
Review by - Google
five star review by
Dave L:
Beautiful high quality wine & tapas restaurant of the upscale category. Friendly service, delicious food at a reasonable price level.
Review by - Google
five star review by
Alberto S:
We'll executed dishes. The Seafood and the Pollo Loco Paella are the real deal. We also ordered the Octopus and the Calamari which also tasted great. Finally,  the servers were very nice and accommodating!
Review by - Google
five star review by
Damien S:
One of the best restaurants around especially if you love Spanish and Basque Country food. As a native from this area I can tell you they bring me back home with this dinner.

Book Reservation
Our Commitment
DECK. is thoughtful in
our
selection of ingredients for both
our
menu
as well as our
handcrafted
cocktails.
Each menu item focuses on fresh and locally sourced
ingredi
ents
to create a unique dining experience that is fully immersed in the beauty of Hawa
i
ʻ
i’s landscape. Our sustainability doesn’t stop with our food. We also make a conscious effort to use every aspect of an ingredient in our cocktails. An iconic piece of Hawaiian culture, pineapples are also a staple of our menu. We use the fruit of the pineapple for a cordial, the rine to create a vermouth and the frawn for garnish. Inspired by local classics and industry favorites, we are proud of our cocktails that can appeal to any taste bud.
Local Partners
Our team believes that our menu can only be as good as the ingredients we select, s
o we take the time to research and source only the very best local partners, farms, distilleries, and breweries.

Ohana Set
$60.00
季節のトリュフ
Menu
The White Winter Truffle　白トリュフ
$16.00/gram
Tartufo Bianco d’Alba Tuber Magnatum Pico • Tartufo bianco d'Alba is an extremely rare Italian white truffle. These ‘Diamonds‘ of the culinary world are nothing short of mesmerizing! This Specific variety has an intense, penetrating aroma, reminiscent of methane or fermented cheese. It lends itself well to being eaten raw with cold and hot dishes. These enhance aromas of the truffles without masking it. This, the King of Truffles produces an aroma and flavor that is gastronomically unique and wonderfully intoxicating | Harvest Season: From mid-September to mid-January.　イタリア産の最も希少な白トリュフ、Tartufo Bianco d’Alba Tuber Magnatum Pico。料理界の「ダイヤモンド」と呼ばれるこのトリュフは、まさに魅惑的！強烈で独特の香りを持ち、生食や温かい料理との相性抜群。王様トリュフは、その独自の香りと味わいで、ガストロノミー界を魅了します。収穫期：9月中旬から1月中旬
The Black Winter Truffle　黒トリュフ
$6.00/gram
Tuber Melanosporum | The Black Winter Truffle is considered to be the King of the black truffles. The distinctive flavour and its sharp aroma make it one of the most expensive, edible mushrooms in the world. It is known to have the most superior, deep earthy aromas and flavours of black truffles, and is so called the “black diamond” of the table because of its divine taste. It is considered among the most luxurious truffles, and some prefer it to the more famed Tuber Magnatum Pico (White Truffle) | Harvest Season: From mid-November to mid-March in Europe, mid-June to mid-August in Australia.　冬黒トリュフ(Tuber Melanosporum)は、黒トリュフの王様とされています。その独特の風味と鋭い香りは、世界で最も高価な食用キノコの1つとされています。黒トリュフの最高級品種であり、深い土の香りと風味が特徴で、「食卓のブラックダイヤモンド」と呼ばれることもあります。その味わいはおいしさの極みとされ、一部ではより有名なTuber Magnatum Pico（ホワイトトリュフ）を上回ると評価されています。収穫期：ヨーロッパでは11月中旬から3月中旬、オーストラリアでは6月中旬から8月中旬。
Black Summer Truffle　サマートリュフ
$5.00/gram
Tuber Aestivum | The Italian Black Summer truffle's fruiting body has a rough, alligator skin-like surface covered with small diamond-shaped projections, molded by the stones surrounding it in the soil. When mature, the Italian Black Summer truffle is near black on the surface, with a pale, grey flesh with white marbling throughout. It has a rich woodsy aroma with flavors of garlic, wild mushroom and earthy hazelnut undertones. ”Purist Style” and is all about staying as true as possible to the subtle taste of Summer Truffles. This is a route that many Michelin starred chefs choose to take, it’s not as simple because it requires more creativity and research to find ingredients that will pair beautifully with Summer Truffles and adorn their flavor instead of overpowering it | Harvest Season: From mid-May to the end of August.　イタリアのブラックサマートリュフ(Tuber Aestivum)は、表面がラフでワニの皮のような質感で、小さなダイヤモンド状の突起物があり、周囲の石によって形作られています。成熟すると、表面はほぼ黒色で、淡い灰色の肉に白い大理石状の模様が見られます。リッチな森の香りとにんにく、野生のキノコ、地中のヘーゼルナッツの風味があります。"純粋主義"スタイルで、サマートリュフの微妙な味わいに可能な限り忠実であることが重要です。これは多くのミシュラン星シェフが選ぶスタイルであり、サマートリュフと美しく調和する素材を見つけ、その味わいを引き立てるために創造性と研究が必要です。収穫期：5月中旬から8月末まで。
Only available on UberEats and Pick Up at restaurant

Crispy on the outside, fluffy and tender on the inside—this is the unagi we've dreamed of serving. After a decade of refinement at Margotto Tokyo, our original preparation method has finally come to life in Hawaii.
Available during restaurant hours (5:00 PM – 10:30 PM) at Margotto’s champagne counter.

Spinning Pies,
Making Savory Sauce & Homemade Pasta
Call (808) 376-8623
From Our Kitchen to your Table
We have been making meals together for over two decades. Â We assemble teams of incredible people to create with. Â Rooted in family recipes and sprung into the modern world, we use fresh ingredients to recreate classic Italian delights. Â Salads, Appetizers, Sandwiches, Pizza Pies, Calzones, Pasta, and Dessert.
Explore the menu
Gathering
We want to give you options. Â We want to make your life a little bit easier and more enjoyable so you can enjoy the people around you.
1
Dine In
Order from our dine in menu, AND our cocktail menu. We have 2 booths and 2 standing tables. Â Both built for conversation!
2
Sit outside
Enjoy ordering from our dine in menu. Â Outside beer, wine, Â and cocktail service available..
3
Order Online
Carry out fresh, hot food, and enjoy at home, or at someone elseâs home!
4
Call in your order
Speak to our staff to place an order or answer any questions you may have.
5
Provisions
Browse our âTake it Home. Make it Your Ownâ coolers.
We have everything youâll need to enjoy the Repetti traditions in your own space. From fresh pastas, sauces, salads, sandwiches, and even desert, we got you!
We also have a curated selection of table decor, from linens to pasta bowls.
Menu
Hatch and Miriam bring to you Repettiâs Pizza and Provisions.
Serpicoâs Pizza and Prison Street Pizza in Maui now have a cousin in Hawaii Kai.
We have been providing Jersey Style Pizza in Maui since 2006. Â We are rooted in tradition and are thrilled to bring our traditions to you, here in Hawaii Kai. Â We are so happy to be here. Cocktails, Beer, and Wine available for dine in.

About Us
A hidden gem tucked away above the Kuhio Avenue hubbub, serving reimagined Pacific Rim cuisine morning, noon and night in a relaxed, open lanai setting. Find us in Waikiki’s newest urban oasis, The Laylow, Autograph Collection.

Featured
Quick View
$250 Gift Card + FREE Melting Hot Chocolate Soufflé Kit - Online Exclusive Offer
$250.00
ROY’S HAWAII KAI IS WHERE IT ALL STARTED MORE THAN 30 YEARS AGO.  THE “ORIGINAL ROY’S” IS TRULY A NEIGHBORHOOD FAMILY RESTAURANT AND STILL HAS THE SAME BUZZ AND VIBE IT HAD IN 1988.  WITH ITS COMFORTABLE OPEN KITCHEN IN THE DINING ROOM, IT IS A PLACE WHERE FIRST TIME VISITORS FALL IN LOVE WITH THE SAME FEELING LOCALS ENJOY TIME AND AGAIN.  ROY ENVISIONED A PLACE WHERE “EVERYBODY KNOWS YOUR NAME.”   DINE WITH US AND ENJOY THE “ORIGINAL ROY’S” EXPERIENCE WITH OUTSTANDING FOOD, SERVICE AND AN AMAZING VIEW OF MAUNALUA BAY.

Our private dining room is perfect for family gatherings, celebrations and business entertaining.  Let us help you create an unforgettable event!  Overlooking the beautiful Maunalua Bay, our private dining. Includes one-on-one consultation for special menu planning and pricing.  Includes wi-fi access and television monitor for presentations.  Restaurant buy-out is available for parties up to 240 guests.

name: Dell's Kitchen and Bakery
raw_text:
Menu
Order Takeout
Dell's Kitchen
Quality Plate Lunches
Order Takeout
Quality cuisine made with love and experience.
DELL'S KITCHEN
Dell’s Kitchen and Bakery is the brainchild of Chef Dell Valdez. His love and passion for food and creativity has led him to open his first takeout eatery along with a bakery. Drawing from his years of culinary experience in some of Hawaii’s best restaurants, Chef has applied those techniques to his interpretation of “Local Style/Asian” food. Layers of flavor, local products, and always with Aloha is what can and to be expected here at “d.k.b”.
Directions

How we use cookies
We may request cookies to be set on your device. We use cookies to let us know when you visit our websites, how you interact with us, to enrich your user experience, and to customize your relationship with our website.
Click on the different category headings to find out more. You can also change some of your preferences. Note that blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience on our websites and the services we are able to offer.
Essential Website Cookies

Because these cookies are strictly necessary to deliver the website, refuseing them will have impact how our site functions. You always can block or delete cookies by changing your browser settings and force blocking all cookies on this website. But this will always prompt you to accept/refuse cookies when revisiting our site.
We fully respect if you want to refuse cookies but to avoid asking you again and again kindly allow us to store a cookie for that. You are free to opt out any time or opt in for other cookies to get a better experience. If you refuse cookies we will remove all set cookies in our domain.
We provide you with a list of stored cookies on your computer in our domain so you can check what we stored. Due to security reasons we are not able to show or modify cookies from other domains. You can check these in your browser security settings.
Check to enable permanent hiding of message bar and refuse all cookies if you do not opt in. We need 2 cookies to store this setting. Otherwise you will be prompted again when opening a new browser window or new a tab.
Click to enable/disable essential site cookies.
Other external services
We also use different external services like Google Webfonts, Google Maps, and external Video providers. Since these providers may collect personal data like your IP address we allow you to block them here. Please be aware that this might heavily reduce the functionality and appearance of our site. Changes will take effect once you reload the page.

Creamy Classic Tori-Paitan
chicken broth, chicken chashu, dehydrated tomato, enoki mushroom tempura, seared corn rib, spinach, butter and chili thread. Served with thick noodles.

grilled eel, shredded egg crepes, cucumber sunomono and top with sesame seed in pockets of deep-fried tofu, simmered in a sweet and savory broth, filled with sushi rice.

Ramen

Fusion of Mexican Birria and Japanese Ramen! spiced beef and chicken broth, slow-cooked birria beef, red
onion, green onion, cilantro and lime. US LOCATIONS.

Chicken clear soup: chicken chashu, green onion, spinach, seasoned egg*, nori seaweed with yuzu flavor. Served with thin noodles.
Tan Tan Men
A savory chicken soy broth with a rich sesame essence, includes tender pork soboro, fresh baby bok choy, and vibrant shredded leek, complemented by a touch of chili sesame seeds and drizzled with chili oil and served with thick noodles.

vegan miso broth: Impossible™ meat made from plants, tofu, bean sprouts, broccolini, green onion, corn, red onion, crispy garlic and chili seasoning » served with thick noodles

About the Business
Established in 2016. Eating House 1849 pays homage to Hawaii's vibrant culinary heritage, a nod to restaurateurs like Peter Fernandez who, the story goes, opened one of the first restaurants in Hawaii, called the Eating House, back in the mid-1800s, using what was available from local farmers, ranchers, foragers and fishermen.

It's here that award-winning Chef Roy Yamaguchi blends these two worlds: the easy ambiance and simple flavors of a plantation town with the dynamic modernity of haute cuisine.
…
Read more

kulu kulu ーJapanese Style Cake Shop in Honolulu, Hawaii
Our story begins in 2012 on Honolulu, Hawaii.
Our talented pastry chefs make every slice of cake with love. We hope to become a “town cake shop” that is close to everyone’s heart. We also want to help inspire children to pursue a future career as pastry chefs.
“ハワイにある街のケーキ屋さん”
クルクルは2012年にハワイ・ホノルルに1号店をオープンしました。才能豊かで経験豊富なパティシエたちが、ひとつひとつのケーキに愛情を込めて作っています。皆さんの心に寄り添い、子どもたちが将来パティシエになりたいと思うきっかけとなるような「街のケーキ屋さん」を目指しています。

Best Mexican Food in Hawaii
“Being from Southern California, I was raised on eating really great Mexican food. It's my favorite type of food. So, naturally anytime we travel to Hawaii I scout out places to eat Mexican food, which is hard to find. That was until I ate at Margaritas. This little hidden gem is the best Mexican food I have found in Hawaii”
-Bryan Murphy
Owner of Hawaii’s Best Podcast
Listen to Episode
happy hour
3-6pm
Vegetarian Friendly
We take pride in serving a large selection of Vegetarian items such as our Chile Relleno.  Served with herb lime rice and black beans (no animal fat).

Careers

Food Menu
Eat.  Drink.  Aloha.
Local Favorites 604 Style.
Looking for the best waterfront fusion restaurant in Honolulu? Restaurant 604 blends Pacific Rim and American cuisine in a relaxing Pearl Harbor setting.
Our menu blends American and Pacific Rim flavors using fresh, local ingredients—perfect for military families, locals, and visiting guests seeking a unique island-inspired dining experience.
Reservations
Takeout
Delivery
The Best Restaurant in Honolulu
Restaurant 604, established in 2016, is a top-rated waterfront fusion restaurant in Honolulu, Hawaii. Known for its warm aloha spirit, the restaurant welcomes military families, locals, and visitors with a relaxed, island-inspired atmosphere.
Blending American and Pacific Rim cuisine with fresh, local ingredients, our menu celebrates Hawaii’s culinary traditions. With live music, stunning views of Pearl Harbor, and a laid-back surf vibe, Restaurant 604 offers an unforgettable dining experience right on the water.
Online Waitlist
For parties of 10 or more, an automatic gratuity of 18% will be added to your bill. This gratuity is 100% distributed to the service staff to ensure excellent service.

small batch, decadent but ready to be drank. Dark red fruits with hints of clove and allspice
Nero d’Avola/Zibbibo, FRESH AF, Unico Zelo, Riverland, Australlia 2023 68

winery describes this as ‘smashable’. we agree.

fresh fruit, silky texture, and well balanced
Pinot Noir, MONTSECANO REFUGIO, Casablanca, Chile 2021 64

this natural, funky fresh wine is 100% bio-dynamic and delicious
Pinot Noir, MELVILLE ESTATE, Santa Rita Hills, CA 2022 78

Pinot Noir/Gamay, SANTINI, Burgundy,France 2022 70

light on its feet but full of personality, this blend from Santini is your French bestie who knows how to have a good time

from the iconic elizabetta foradori, this pale-colored red is a lovely aperitif with crunchy red fruit and pleasant bitterness

an expressive representation of an indigenous grape to the region. timeless and bold with a structured lingering finish

this juicy california cutie is a wild red blend full of crunchy red fruit, spicy sass, and serious chillable charm

name: Heavenly Island Lifestyle - Hawaii Kai
address: 7192 Kalanianaole Hwy, Ste D-105, Honolulu, HI 96825
raw_text:
Menu | Heavenly Island Lifestyle Hawaiikai

MENU FEATURES
HEAVENLY Hawai’i Kai serves a diverse clientele of all ages.
Menu items are nourishing, comforting and enjoyable for families or for a meal out with friends.
We offer breakfast, lunch and dinner daily. Each experience offers scenic dining with marina views.
BREAKFAST & LUNCH
CAFE & HAPPY HOUR
DINNER
DRINK
DRINK - Wine List -
^
Breakfast
Come for signature dishes, such as HEAVENLY Loco Moco or Eggs Benedict made with local eggs.
Indulge in fluffy pancakes, get energized with our Healthy Morning Veggie Set or try a traditional Japanese-style Teishoku.
Enjoy with freshly ground coffee, espresso, fresh orange juice or lemonade, or celebrate with our Local-Style Craft Mimosas.
Perfect for locals and visitors alike.
Lunch
Come for our LOCAL FARM SALAD BAR.
We also feature our Hainanese chicken rice, specialty pastas, local pork bibimbap, delicious tacos, and more.
Afternoon cocktails are always a treat on the veranda,
especially our refreshing HEAVENLY Organic Margaritas.
Cafe & Happy Hour
Our desserts are “must haves’’.
Custard pudding alamode, a variety of Parfaits and ITO EN Matcha Tiramisu will ensure a tasty afternoon. Whether you’re in the mood for something sweet or savory, one of our Specialty Cocktails will complement any menu selection.
DINNER
Come enjoy our sunset view on the Marina.
Begin your meal with a craft beer,
we partner with Aloha Beer Company to produce our HEAVENLY PALE ALE.
Enjoy appetizers made with local ingredients, then savor fresh local fish or a delectable steak inspired
by our sister restaurant Aloha Steak House.
HEAVENLY Island Lifestyle Hawaii Kai is the great new dinner location on the EAST COAST of OAHU.
BREAKFAST & LUNCH
CAFE & HAPPY HOUR
DINNER

our fixed daily menu
Beef
Our beef plates include two sides.
SIDE OPTIONS
Steamed White, Brown or Hapa Rice; sauteed Buttered Corn, Broccoli, Carrots, Tossed Green or Potato-Macaroni Salad.
Braised Boneless Beef Shortribs
24.95
One of our signature dishes. Boneless Beef Short Ribs braised in our Red Wine braising sauce until fork tender and served with our Demi-sauce.
Boneless Korean Kalbi Plate
23.95
Boneless Beef Short Ribs marinated in our house Korean sauce then charbroiled to order and topped with Kim-chee.
Guava BBQ Beef Brisket
20.95
Beef Brisket braised, lightly grilled then smothered with our house Guava BBQ sauce and topped with our homemade Coleslaw.
Fresh Hamburger Steak
17.95

Steak Plate

Garlic-Butter Steak
17.95

17.95

Teriyaki Beef
16.95
Sliced, marinated teriyaki beef charbroiled to perfection.

19.95

Chimchurri Chicken Breast
17.95

with furikake sprinkles, bubu arare, gochujang aioli and green onions.
Kim-Chee Chicken

Hibachi Chicken

Garlic Chicken
16.95
Tender morsels of chicken deep-fried until golden brown tossed in our famous house made garlic sauce.
Chicken Katsu
16.95

Poutine Chicken Katsu
17.95
Panko crusted Chicken topped with shredded Cheese and Brown Gravy.

different
items: Chicken Katsu, Garlic Chicken, Hurricane chicken, freshly ground Hamburger Steak, Chimichurri steak, Garlic steak or 5pc garlic shrimp

23.95

Catch Combo
18.95

Burger Menu
All of our beef burgers are freshly ground daily, perfectly seasoned, charbroiled, and are served with shredded lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, grilled red onion, crispy fried onions, and our house secret house spread. Includes one side. Our burgers are cooked medium-rare to medium unless otherwise requested. Served with Hand cut French Fries or one side.
Plain Jane Burger
13.95

Classic Cheese Burger
15.95
One 6 ounce charbroiled beef patty, sliced sharp Cheddar & Swiss cheese between a grilled brioche bun. with all the fixings.
Bacon Cheddar Cheese Burger
17.95
Our 6 ounce all beef, charbroiled beef patty, sharp cheddar cheese, and bacon with all the fixings.
Avocado Cheese Burger
17.95
Our 6 ounce all beef, charbroiled Beef patty, sharp cheddar Cheese, Avocado & Bacon with all the fixings.
Mushroom Swisscheese  Burger
16.95
One 6 Ounce charbroiled beef patty topped with sauteed Mushrooms, Bacon & Swiss Cheese with all the fixings.
Mushroom Demi Sauce Cheeseburger
16.95
One 6 oz. charbroiled house-made pure Beef hamburger patty Sharp Cheddar cheese, Demi-sauce and topped with fried onions, special house spread, shredded lettuce, sliced tomatoes and pickles.
Beyond  Burger
16.95
Our plant-based vegetarian burger.
From the Sea

Butter & Roasted Garlic Shrimp
17.95
10 pieces of seasoned, pan-seared de-shelled shrimp finished with our garlic & butter sauce.

Charbroiled Catch

Catch Combo

Pan fried furikake Catch & our Misoyaki Catch.

Braised Beef Shortrib Loco-Moco

Steak Loco-Moco

Seasoned, pan-seared steak, sliced atop a bed of steamed rice topped with brown gravy, two Local eggs.
Loco-Moco Combo

Two freshly ground pure-beef Hamburger Patties topped with our demi sauce and one Local Egg any style with our Famous Garlic Chicken.
Fresh Salads
Our Healthy & Delicious salad selection. All salads are served with our housemade Vinaigrette dressing.
Bulgogi Beef Cobb Salad
16.95
Marinated, chopped charbroiled teriyaki beef over Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, corn kernels, olives, bacon bits, sliced egg, avocado and Chef’s house vinaigrette on the side.
Seared Steak Cobb Salad
17.95
Seared steak diced for your convenience sereved over Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, corn kernels, olives, bacon bits, sliced egg, avocado and Chef’s house vinaigrette on the side.
Kalbi Korean Cobb Salad
17.95
Marinated, charbroiled Korean boneless beef shortribs over Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, corn kernels, olives, bacon bits, sliced egg, avocado and Chef’s house vinaigrette on the side.
Charbroiled Catch Cobb Salad
17.95
Our catch of the day charbroiled to perfection and served over Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, corn kernels, olives, bacon bits, sliced egg, avocado and Chef’s house vinaigrette on the side.
Garlic Chicken Chopped Salad
17.95

Charbroiled Fresh Catch Chopped Salad
18.95
Two seasoned filet's of our fresh catch of the day, charbroiled then situated atop our Chopped salad consisting of   crispy Romaine lettuce, sliced black olives, grape tomatoes, thin sliced red onions, corn kernels, bacon bits, and Parmesan cheese, garnished with Seaweed salad.
Herb Chicken Breast Chimichurri Salad
17.95
Chicken Breast seasoned with spices & herbs then charbroiled topped with our house Chimichurri sauce over crispy Romaine, sliced black olives, grape tomatoes, thin sliced red onions, corn kernels, bacon bits, and Parmesan cheese.
Our Sandwiches
Our Sandwiches include one side, choice of Tossed green or Potato-Macaroni salad, French-fries, steamed Broccoli, Carrots, or buttered Corn kernels.
B.L.T. Avocado Sandwich
15.95

Sauteed Catch Fish Sandwich
18.95

Guava Beef Brisket Melt
18.95

Steak Melt Sandwich
18.95
Sliced steak with caramelized onions, bell peppers, tomato slices, sliced jalapeños, and Swiss Cheese on grilled sourdough bread.
Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich
14.95

FROZEN TROPICAL SLUSHIES
Pineapple, lemonade, or POG (passion fruit + orange juice + guava).

Kama ‘aina and Military appreciation THURSDAYS (25% discount off all food/drinks/alcohol) - KAIMUKI location ONLY, dine-in only
Oahu Mexican Grill

3036 Waialae Ave  | Kaimuki

About the Business
We Offer  Mexican Street food style tacos, Quesadillas, Burritos and  Tortas. On weekends we may Offer Specials like Sea food and other Mexican foods that you can't find anywhere else on the Island. We Prioritize Quality and Consistency so to have the best food we can. We Currently have to Choices of meat; Carne Asada and Adobada. We do not buy cheap meats to make our Meats because we think the Meat you buy matters to the Quality of the food we make. Our Marinates we make For our meats are meant to give you a taste of Mexico you cannot find anywhere else in Hawaii. We hope you enjoy Your Experience with us!

WORK HARD. PLAY HARD. HAPPY HOUR HARDER.
Five Bucks. Bottoms Up.
Why settle for ordinary when you can sip something legendary for just $5? We’ve got the drinks to quench your thirst without draining your wallet. 22oz domestic draft beer including Miller Lite, Bud Light, Michelob Ultra, and Coors Light. Delicious drinks, zero guilt—what’s not to love?
*Only available at select locations
Our Award-Winning Food & drinks
Our seasonal food menu keeps fresh eats on the table for you and awards coming to us. Our drink menu features both classic cocktails and specialty drinks you won't find anywhere else.
*Menu may vary by location.
View Our Menu
Quench Your Thirst
Our drink menu features both classic cocktails and specialty drinks you won't find anywhere else.
View PDF of Our Drink Menu
NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION
ALLERGENS
*Items on the Allergen Menu may vary by location
Game day is all about the cheers.
Win every Sunday, Monday, and Thursday with $5 on 22 oz. select domestic draft beers.
Stay fueled and ready every game day.
Refuel with 10 Wings for $10 every Sunday, Monday, and Thursday.
Game day? Step into the lime light.
Go for the big play every Sunday, Monday, and Thursday with $5 frozen or on the rocks Lime Time ‘Ritas.
It's Happy Hour!
EXCLUSIVE FOOD & BEVERAGE DISCOUNTS
Your taste buds deserve to get in on the fun, too. Unlock exclusive food & non-alcoholic beverage discounts with your Fall Season Pass, including savings on a fall’s worth of fun.
LEARN MORE
LEGENDS AREN’T BORN, THEY’RE MADE – BY OUR CHEFS
We’re not playing games with our food and drink offerings. We feature a seasonal menu of award-winning food and one-of-a-kind cocktails. Dave & Buster’s offers an amazing bar and restaurant experience at every location.
Hand-breaded chicken
House-made sauces
Gluten-Friendly and Vegetarian Options
Brekky Smashed Burger
Time to wake & bacon! Stacked with applewood smoked
bacon, American cheese, grilled onions, bacon aioli, lettuce, tomato & pickles.
Topped with fried egg & hot honey drizzle on a toasted potato bun.
Cali Ceasar Salad Bowl
Get in a golden plate of mind. Grilled chicken, guacamole,
tomatoes, bacon, cucumber, croutons, hard-boiled egg, parmesan & Caesar
dressing.
Papi Chulo Queso
Loaded with pork chorizo (that’s what cheese said), black beans,
roasted corn, fresh pico de gallo, cotija cheese & cilantro. Served with Diablo-
seasoned chips.
S'mores Cheesecake
Mile-high chocolate cheesecake topped with toasted jumbo
marshmallows, chocolate sauce & graham cracker dust.
DON'T SHOW UP EMPTY SEATED
The best way to secure your seat at the table is by reserving one in advance. Our hosts will be delighted to accommodate you and your party. Get in on the games, food, and fun at a Dave & Buster’s near you by reserving a table today.
Make a Reservation
GET READY FOR FUN
Download the D&B Rewards app and prepare for your visit. Play games, accept challenges and track upcoming events with the D&B Rewards App. It's like easy mode for earning rewards.
10 for $10 Wings:
Promotional. Limited time only. Valid at participating locations only. Offer valid only on Sundays, Mondays, and Thursdays. Get traditional and boneless wings with any of our sauces, rubs, or no sauce. Order includes 10 traditional or boneless wings and two (2) sides of ranch or bleu cheese. Up to two choices of sauces or rubs per order. Cannot mix traditional and boneless in the same order. Hours may change by location. Promotional price starts at $10.00 per person, and price may be subject to increase at any time. Prices may vary by location. Offer may be revised or rescinded at any time. Not valid with any other promotion. Dine-in only. No take home bags. Other restrictions may apply. See stores for details. Void where prohibited.
$5 Drinks Only​:
Promotional. Limited time only. Offer includes $5 22 oz. select domestic draft beer, $5 Lime Time Margarita and $5 Lime Time Frozen Margarita. Valid at participating locations only. Offer valid only on Sundays, Mondays, and Thursdays. Beer selection may vary by location. 16 oz. drafts in Canada locations. Hours may change by location. Offer may be revised or rescinded at any time. Not valid with any other promotion. Must be at least 21 years old to consume alcohol. Please drink responsibly. Other restrictions may apply. See stores for details. Void where prohibited.

Today's Hours
The heart of Kailua
For nearly 15 years, Kalapawai in Kailua town has offered residents and visitors a friendly place to grab anything from a morning cup of coffee, a delicious deli sandwich or pizza to an award-winning full-service dinner that includes burgers, locally caught seafood and the freshest salads.
Hours
OPEN MON-FRI @ 6:00 AM / SAT & SUN @ 7:00 AM   CLOSE SUN-THUR @ 8:30 PM / FRI & SAT @ 9:00 PM
Contact
(808) 262-3354
cafe@kalapawaimarket.com
Menu
We are proud to feature locally sourced ingredients whenever possible on our menu and we focus our wine and beverage program around small, family-owned wineries and breweries. 270 Kuulei Road, Kailua, HI 96734

Our story
Family owned
Being raised in Kailua our family goal was to deliver a product to our community that was both traditional yet a hint of local flair.
We found a niche that needed to be filled and Bowles Burritos was created and ready to spring into business!
Delicious food made daily, slow-cooked meats, homemade salsa, fresh tortillas and produce from local vendors.
Bowles Burritos Family (OHANA) is committed to offering the best to both our loyal local families and our treasured visitors.
Our menu
ORDER ONLINE
WE PACK'EM TIGHT AND ROLL'EM FAT

Reviews
review by - Yelp
Jason H.:
I like it! The burritos are great; I usually get chicken. My wife gets the tacos and has chicken. It's wild that we get nearly identical stuff and they still taste slightly different in a good way. Both are delightful.
review by - Yelp
Terri H.:
Pet friendly, awesome food, great drinks! Close to home enjoyed the people! Seat yourself bar with fun games.
review by - Yelp
Nicholas A.:
I've never been disappointed eating here. Always consistent and good.  They have a loyalty program too.
review by - Yelp
Ryan B.:
Better than any Chipotle ever. The price, unbeatable. The service, polite and even funny and witty. Oh, and it has trivia and serves beer. I wish I found this spot earlier

Training Fee
We add a 3% training surcharge to our checks. This small fee helps offset some of our costs associated with the vocational training investment we are making in our team as we provide them with work skills as part of their substance abuse disorder recovery. We appreciate your understanding and support of our staff. The fee is voluntary and upon request, we will gladly remove it from your check.

name: EbiNomi
raw_text:
EbiNomi - Menu
日本語
EbiNomi focuses on "comfort food" 
			from different parts of the world.  All of them unpretentious 
			but super delicious and wonderfully satisfying.
All the main dishes we 
			are offering right now are individual serving sizes, with an "ohana" 
			option to double it for family style dining.
EbiNomi is all about.....
A word about pricing...
Our cost of goods is 
			high because we use quality ingredients and our portions are 
			generous. The prices you see here on this page are the minimums that 
			we have to charge to stay in business.
When you order through 
			a 3rd party delivery service like UberEats, they keep 30% of the 
			money they collect from you. Therefore, we have to mark up our 
			prices on those platforms accordingly to compensate for their 30% 
			surcharges.
If paying a lower 
			price is important to you, please
order 
			directly from us via the red button below
. We deliver just 
			the same as they do or you can choose to do curbside pickup.
Thank you for your 
			understanding in this tough time.
P L A T E   R I C E   M E N U  (served 
			9 am to 9 pm)
Garlic Shrimps (EbiKahuku)  ガーリックシュリンプ
Garlic 
			shrimp Kahuku style.  Like those shrimps you get on the North 
			shore, only larger, peeled, and cooked "just right".  
			Served over a bed of steamed rice.
$18.95 (single) $37.90 (double order)
+ $1.00 spicy option
EbiCurry  海老カレー
Jumbo shrimps (peeled) with potato, cherry tomatoes and asparagus 
			spears sautéed in
our special yellow curry sauce made of spices 
			and seasoning from the famous Blue Elephant restaurant in Bangkok. 
			Imported exclusively from Thailand for EbiNomi.
$18.95 (single) $37.90 (double order)
Chicken Curry  チキンカレー
Tender 
			boneless chicken and vegetables in our special yellow curry sauce 
			made of spices and seasoning from the famous Blue Elephant 
			restaurant in Bangkok. Imported exclusively from Thailand for 
			EbiNomi
$18.95 (single) $37.90 (double order)
Ebi 
			à la King  ホワイトクリーム海老
Jumbo shrimps
(peeled)
in our rich, cream sauce with mushrooms, 
			onions, bell peppers.
$18.95 (single) $37.90 (double order)
Chicken 
			à la King  ホワイトクリームチキン
Tender 
			boneless chicken in our rich, cream sauce with mushrooms, onions, 
			bell peppers.
$18.95 (single) $37.90 (double order)
VegiCurry  ベジタリアンカレー
Cauliflower and broccoli  in our special yellow curry 
			sauce made of spices and seasoning from the famous Blue Elephant 
			restaurant in Bangkok. Imported exclusively from Thailand for EbiNomi
$18.95 (single) $37.90 (double order)
(for STRICT vegetarians, please review the 
			complete ingredient list)
Vegi 
			à la King  ホワイトクリーム野菜
Cauliflower and broccoli in our rich, cream sauce with mushrooms, onions, 
			bell peppers.
$18.95 (single) $37.90 (double order)
(for STRICT vegetarians, please review the 
			complete ingredient list)
Hungarian Beef  ハンガリー風ビーフシチュー
(Formerly 
			named Hungarian Beef Stew)
Premium boneless beef short ribs 
			for a good mixture of lean and fat. This is slow cooked for 48 hours to 
			perfection in 
			wine and a tomato sauce based on an ancient Hungarian recipe. 
			Accompanied by organic carrots and Klondike potatoes cooked just 
			right.
$18.95 (single serving) $37.90 (double order)
Limited Quantity
F R Y     M E N U  
			(served 9 am to 8:30 pm)
On deep 
			fried items below: Even 
			though we will prepare these items for to-go orders and deliveries, 
			we highly recommend all deep fried items to be consumed immediately.
Chicken /
			Tori Karaage
(Japanese style fried chicken)
鶏の唐揚げ
A long time favorite Japanese style fried chicken.  
			Each bite size piece is made from high quality boneless chicken well-marinated 
			with soy sauce and other secret ingredients cradled in a crispy coating.  Crispy on the outside, 
			tender and juicy inside.  Served with rice.
$17.95
EbiCoconut
ココナッツシュリンプ (フライドポテト付き)
Six jumbo shrimps coated with coconut flakes deep 
			fried to perfection.  Served with our premium French fries.
$17.95
Fish 'N Chips
フィッシュ&チップス
Beer battered (light) Atlantic cod
deep fried to perfection.
Served with our premium French fries.
3 pieces $17.95
4 pieces $19.95
Hiroshima Fried Oysters
広島産牡蠣フライ
Jumbo oysters from Hiroshima breaded and deep 
			fried to perfection.
Served with rice or our premium French fries.
4 oysters $17.95
6 oysters $19.95
S P E C I A L S
Prime Rib
* Served ONLY on Special Occasions *
USDA Prime grade beef slow cooked to perfection.  
			Served with au jus, creamed horseradish and vegetables
$29.95
S I 
			D E   O R D E R   M E N U  (served 9 am to 
			8:30 pm)
Ika 
			Karaage (Fried Squid)
イカから揚げ
Squid body and geso breaded in special seasoning 
			deep fried to perfection.  Perfect to go with a cold bottle of 
			beer!
$6.95
Shrimp Spring Rolls
えび春巻 / 鮮蝦春卷
Yummy shrimps encased in thin wrappings deep fried to crispiness
$9.95 (4 pieces)
Takoyaki (Octopus balls)
たこ焼き
Octopus meat encased in a batter which include 
			tempura crunchies, pickled ginger and green onion.
$6.95 (5 pieces)
Potato Shrimps
t m khoai t y
Yummy shrimps encased in potato spaghetti deep fried to crispiness
$7.95 (5 pieces)
Steamed rice  ご飯
$1.95 (10 oz portion)
[1]
Due to availability management, these items 
			may NOT be 
			available through 3rd party delivery platforms such as UberEats or DoorDash.
[2]
For ALL dishes, prices are higher in 3rd 
			party delivery platforms because of their 30% surcharges.  We 
			would be out of business very soon if we give away 30% of our 
			revenue.
THREE WAYS 
			TO GET YOUR FOOD**:
Pick it up at our shop.  
			While you are there, take a selfie with Bubba our guard owl.
MAP
Pick it up curbside (on 
			Nohonani).  Call us and we will bring it out to you.
744 
			1661
MAP
Have it delivered.  
			We are currently set up with DoorDash for deliveries **
** We highly recommend 
			#1 or #2 - coming by to get your food.  Due to the "dine at 
			home" situation in Hawaii, the delivery services have been super 
			taxed and we have heard a lot of complaints about 3rd party 
			deliveries... factors beyond our control
Copyright © 2024  
			EbiNomi Inc. All 
			Rights Reserved  contact:
info@EbiNomi.com

About Café Kaila
Welcome to Café Kaila!
I would like to share with you some of my favorite things to eat.
This menu was created because I have a passion for cooking and I especially love to eat breakfast. These dishes are a collection of my best recipes that I often make for family and friends.
I am proud of the fact that we serve fresh, wholesome food that is thoughtfully prepared and attractively presented. The secret ingredient in everything is love! I hope you enjoy your meal.
Thank you for visiting! : ) Love, Kaila
Beginnings
After its nondescript opening in 2007, Café Kaila quickly became one of the most talked about breakfast cafes in the area. Word spread quickly, and within months of opening, there were lines outside the door. Since then, Café Kaila has gone from strength to strength, and in 2012 opened its second store in Tokyo, Japan. We stay true to our original philosophy though, and never forget those who helped us to get where we are now.
Accolades
In 2011, Café Kaila won the inaugural gold medal in the Best Breakfast category of Honolulu Magazine's Hale 'Aina awards. The awards are the culmination of a ballot among readers of the magazine, who vote for their favorite restaurants in the state of Hawaii. Café Kaila was a finalist in 2012, and won the silver medal in 2013.
From 2014 to 2017, Cafe Kaila won the fourth consecutive gold medal in the Best Breakfast category of Honolulu Magazine's Hale 'Aina awards.
Philosophy
It always has been, and always will be the case that customers come first at Café Kaila.  The quality of food (inside, outside, and of course taste), and all-round dining experience are fundamental to everyone at Café Kaila. Even at the busiest times, we do our best to make everyone's experience as pleasant as possible, be they a local or a tourist, waiting to come in or paying the check.

Sightseeing Spots
Near Cafe Kaila
There are a lot of famous sightseeing spots in and around the Cafe Kaila area in Honolulu. 
		Listed on this page are just a few of those spots. Please note that access refers to accessing the locations from Cafe Kaila.
KCC Saturday Farmers' Market
A lot of local farmers, shops, and restaurants setup here and you can always find something different each time you visit.
		It's easy to get here by bus or trolley.
		The merchandise here also makes for great souvenirs and a lot of it can be obtained at very reasonable prices, some of which
		are cheaper than in Waikiki itself.
The event is normally held on Saturday morning, but recently is also being held on Tuesday evenings.
Information
Hours
7:30-11:00 (Sat)
					16:00-19:00 (Tue)
Address
4303 Diamond Head Rd.
					Honolulu, HI 96816
Access
Number 3, 22, or 58 bus
URL
http://hfbf.org/markets/markets/kcc/
South Shore Paperie
This is a paper store run by a local couple and is located very close to Cafe Kaila.
		The wife is in charge of design and the husband takes care of printing and PR.
		There are lots of great letter heads and notebooks that have that natural Hawaiian color to them.
Recently, their products are also being sold in a lot of other stores in Waikiki, but 
		the best experience is done so at the head store.
They are also popular with help in preparing materials for wedding ceremonies in Hawaii.
Information
Hours
9:00-16:00 (Mon-Thu)
					10:00-18:00 (Fri,Sat)
					Closed Sun
Address
1016 Kapahulu Ave.
					Honolulu, HI 96816
					Kilohana Square #190
Access
Take the #13 bus from Kilohana Square on the corner of Kapahulu Ave. and Kihei Pl. to Kapahulu and Campbell.  Approx. 20 minutes.
URL
http://southshorepaperie.com/
Sugarcane Shop
After leaving Cafe Kaila, pass under the highway and turn right. You'll pass by a lot of great restaurants before arriving at the top of the hill in Kaimuki.
The theme is shabby and chic. There are lots of great thngs available from apparel, jewelry, interior, and miscellaneous goods.
Information
Hours
10:30-18:0 (Tue-Sun)
					Closed Mon
					Please inquire the store for national holidays
Address
1137 11th Avenue, #101
					Honolulu, HI 96816
Access
Can be reached by walking, but car is better. Plenty of parking is available.
Kapiolani Regional Park
This extensive park is on the western end of Waikiki, at the foot of the Diamond Head. 
		It's a convenient spot to take a walk or a break after having finished a meal at Cafe Kaila and return to the center of Waikiki.
You can have a wonderful time seeing Diamond Head, palm trees, the beach, and Honolulu Zoo.
		Other activities include visiting the Waikiki Aquarium and Waikiki War Memorial.
Information
Hours
5:00-24:00
Address
Kalakaua Ave. / Monsarrat Ave. / Paki Ave.
Access
10-15 minute walk from central Waikiki.
					2 minute bus ride from Kuhio Ave. (#2 bus)
Royal Hawaiian Resort
The Royal Hawaiian Resort is a pink resort hotel situated in a location that faces Diamond Head.
		It not only features a restaurant and a bar, but also a spa and it even conducts weddings.
		A very popular place.
Information
Address
2259 Kalakaua Ave.
Honolulu, HI 96815
Access
10-15 minute walk from central Waikiki.
					2 minute bus ride from Kuhio Ave. (#2 bus)
URL
https://www.royal-hawaiian.com/
Great Japanese Food
Around Hawaii
Hawaii has lots of great places to enjoy a good meal.
		Matcha Stand Maiko, a sister store to Cafe Kaila opened in 2016 and their feature product is their line of matcha soft serve.
		In this page, we'll discuss some places where you can get great Japanese food in the Hawaii area.
Matcha Stand Maiko
As mentioned earlier, this is a sister store to Cafe Kaila where customers can enjoy great matcha soft serve among other drinks.
		It's close to the beach so you can enjoy time on the beach with some great matcha drinks. The store has grown in popularity since opening.
All products are made using authentic Japanese grown tea leaves. Best of all, matcha is a very nutritious drink. Definitely check it out.
What's Japanese about it?
Matcha is a regular drink all around Japan. It's enjoyed by people of all ages.
				Matcha Stand Maiko also provides the matcha pancake, which is a popular item on Cafe Kaila's menu.
Marukame Udon
It's a little ways away from Cafe Kaila, but Marukame Udon is near Matcha Stand Maiko and is a popular noodle chain all around Japan.
		They offer plenty of varieties of noodles as well as tempura products. They are good at filling orders quickly.  Give them a try.
What's Japanese about it?
This chain has hundreds of locations all around Japan and is a big success.
				It's popular because it's quick, inexpensive, and convenient.
Shirokiya
Most people think Japanese food is expensive, but Shirokiya is quite reasonable with its prices.
		They even $1 beers and pitchers for $5. It's located in the middle of the Ala Moana Center and a great spot to visit in Hawaii.
What's Japanese about it?
Shirokiya is an izakaya, the Japanese style tavern. They offer a wide range of foods so anyone can enjoy it.
				The store is easily accessible, very spacious, and very reasonable.
Great Hawaiian Food
Near Cafe Kaila
After enjoying some breakfast at Cafe Kaila there are lots of other great cafes and restaurants nearby Cafe Kaila.
		If you're visiting Hawaii, we have some recommendations you should check out.
Leonard's  Hawaii
Originating in Portugal, it's a a very popular store with lots of customers throughout the day.
		Their speciality is gourmet Malasada, which comes in 3 varieties: Plain, Cinnamon, and Li Hing.
		They also offer fillings such as chocolate, custard, and more making for lots of variety.
		In addition to malasadas, they also offer pumpkin pie, cupcakes, muffins, and more.
		If you're staying in Hawaii for a while, they also offer boxed options that make for great souvenirs.
Info
Address: 933 Kapahulu Ave, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96816-1434
URL: https://www.leonardshawaii.com/home/
Waiola Shave Ice
Founded in 1940, this is one of hte top shaved ice shops popular in Honolulu.
		One unique menu item is the Obama Rainbow, which has combines passion fruits, limes, cherries, condensed milk, and adzuki beans topped with mochi.
		With over 40 different kinds of syrup, you'll have plenty to choose from.
Once you try their shaved ice, you'll never forget it.
Info
Address: 3113 Mokihana St, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96816-6500
URL: http://www.waiolashaveice.com/
Ono Seafood
Ono Seafood offers a popular Poke Bowl and is popular among the Hawaiian locals.
		There are two varieties: Ahi Poke, which uses fresh tuna, and Tako Poke, which uses octopus.
		Soy sauce, miso, spicy, Hawaiian, and wasabi are available for seasoning.
		The poke bowl also goes great with white or brown rice.
Info
Address: 747 Kapahulu Ave, Honolulu, HI 96816
URL: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Ono-Seafood/121018077909974
Sightseeing Spots
Near Cafe Kaila 2
There are a lot of famous sightseeing spots in and around the Cafe Kaila area in Honolulu. 
		Listed on this page are just a few more of those spots.
Honolulu Zoo
Easy to access in Waikiki and enjoyable by people of all ages. It has a spacious garden and plenty of playground equipment and lawn plazas.
		Many people from locals to tourists come throughout the year.
It's a full-sized zoo with many kinds of animals including the popular lions, zebras, cheetahs, elephants, giraffes as well as different kinds of birds, reptiles, and more!
Information
Hours
9:00-16:30
Address
151 Kapahulu Ave, Honolulu, HI 96815
URL
https://www.honoluluzoo.org/
Waikiki Aquarium
Opened in 1904, this historical aquarium has been operating for over 100 years.
		There are plenty of popular marine exhibits with all kinds of aquatic organisms from the tropical regions of the Pacific.
		The aquarium is focused on the research and protection of such organisms.
One very popular exhibit is the Hawaiian Monk Seal. Be sure to visit here.
Information
Hours
9:00-16:30
Address
2777 Kalakaua Ave, Honolulu, HI 96815
Diamond Head State Monument
Diamond Head is a landmark of Hawaii. When westerners landed long ago, it is said that the mountaintop was named Diamond Head because it shines like a diamond.
It's 232 meters tall and is one of the most beautiful places in Hawaii.  The view from the top is breathtaking and is one of the must-visit places in Hawaii.
		A climb to the summit can take around 30 minutes to an hour.
Information
Hours
6:00-18:00
Address
96815 Honolulu
Shopping Around
Cafe Kaila
When you're in Hawaii, after dropping by Cafe Kaila for some pancakes, you'll probably want to do some shopping. Check out some of these places nearby.
Foodland Market City
This supermarket came to Hawaii from Pennsylvania in 1948 after World War 2 and has locations in Oahu, Maui, Hawaii and Kauai. 
		There are plenty of great, fresh foods and some stores have bakeries and delis.
		In addition to that, souvenirs and beach goods are also available.
		People really like going here while waiting their turn in line at Cafe Kaila.
Information
Hours: 24 hours
Address: 2939 Harding Ave, Honolulu, HI 96816
URL: http://www.foodland.com/stores/foodland-market-city
Simply Wood Studios
Many high quality wood products are available and they make great gifts.
		The staff is also friendly and helpful. Some products include pens, ornaments, accessories, jewelry, etc.
		The most popular items are the pens with their elegant curves and beautiful wood grain.
		They are also fitted with pink or blue acrylic to give them that Hawaii look.
		While they may seem a little pricey, they do make great souvenirs.
Information
Hours: 9:00 - 17:00 (M-F), 10:00 - 17:00 (Sat), Closed Sun
Address: 932 Kapahulu Ave, Honolulu, HI 96816
URL: https://www.simplywoodstudios.com/
Downing Hawaii
Surfing's always been popular in Hawaii and this is a surf shop that locals love going to.  
		Varoius boards such as the Dart, Duster, Slippah, Minihune, and Longboard are available and can be customized.
		You can get a board for any situation. Boards with the shop's "D" logo are also popular.
		These also make great souvenirs.
Information
Address: 3021 Waialae Ave, Honolulu, HI 96816
URL: http://www.downingsurf.com/
The Importance of Breakfast
Despite knowing it's generally bad to skip breakfast, people may give excuses for doing so such as: "I want to sleep longer" or "I don't feel hungry". 
		In this page, we will discus some recommendations as well as the importance of breakfast.
Risks of skipping breakfast
Breakfast is an important energy source to help start the day.
		If skipped, one won't have enough energy throughout the day and over time one might feel dizziness
		a lack of concentration, and fatigue. One may even develop hypoglycemia over time.
It is said that the brain consumes 2 to 30% of the total glucose intake as energy.  Therefore, breakfast is necessary in order keep the brain working.
It's important to develop these eating habits early on. From childhood, it's important to have a good habit of eating.
If one does not eat, problems will arise in terms of learning and emotional development, and it is said that it also affects one's personality.
		Such eating habits are important all the way into adulthood.
Stop having dinner late
If one eats late at night, it will carry into the next day as the food won't be fully asorbed nor digested thus giving one little to no appetite in the morning.
		If you have to have something late at night, try supplements or even a simple light food like cereal or crackers that won't linger until the next morning.
Breakfast is good for dieting
Skipping any meal (not only breakfast) will often lead to overeating in the following meal, which will then cause a sharp rise in the blood glucose level.
		This sudden rise in blood sugar is bad for dieting.
Certain Miss Universe models practice the habit of eating five to six meals a day so as to prevent blood sugar from rising sharply.
		Maintaining a good blood sugar level is one of the keys to maintaining a good weight.
The solution: Frozen pancakes!
Pancakes can be easily made by mixing powder, eggs, and milk. In addition, they also contain the three major nutrients which are carbohydrates, protein, and fat.
Pancakes can be stored frozen and come in a wide variety of flavors so you'll be able to find your favorite taste.
What do you think? The Hawaiian locals enjoy this simple yet delicious style of breakfast and so can you!
Shopping Around
Cafe Kaila
For a trip to Hawaii, there's of course plenty of food and activities to enjoy, but taking something back with you is also a must.
		This page will introduce some ideas of some good things to get.
Honolulu Cookie Company
Their speciality is the pineapple-shaped shortbread cookie.
		The secret to the good taste is the ingredients used which include high quality chocolate, flour, butter, and more.
		There are lots of flavors to choose from including pineapple, Kona coffee, coconut.
		Definitely give these a try.
Information
Address: Royal Hawaiian Center, B-1F
Phone Number: (808) 931-3330
Business Hours: 9:00-23:00
Days Off: None
Hawaii Coffee Company
Coffee is one of the main products of Hawaii and one of the most famous varieties is Kona coffee.
		There are only a few times in the year where it's opportune to cultivate it so prices can be a little high,
		but such great quality coffee will make any coffee lover happy.
		It also goes great with bread and pancakes among other breakfasts.
Information
Address: 1555 Kalani Street Honolulu, HI 96817
Phone Number: (800) 338-8353
Business Hours: 6:00-17:00
Days Off: Sunday
Burt's Bees
A popular, organic cosmetic brand. Products offered include creams, cleansers, shampoos and more. They make great souvenirs for the ladies.
		The most popular product, however, is their lip balm which is great for protecting against dry lips.
		Their products can be found around Hawaii, but we recommend the ABC Store.
Information
ABC Store Ala Moana Center
Address: 1450 Ala Moana Boulevard, Honolulu, HI 96814
Phone Number: (808) 941-3374
Business Hours: 9:30-21:00
Days Off: None
Whole Foods Market
A popular natural and organic supermarket. This is great if you're looking for a more miscellanous souvenir.
		Some ideas include their body care products or the eco bags. Different prices and designs are available, so there's a lot to choose from to meet your needs.
Information
Address: 4211 Wai'alae Avenue Honolulu, HI 96816
Phone Number: (808) 738-0820
Business Hours: 7:00-22:00
Days Off: None
*Note: The information on this page may be subject to change anytime.
The Importance of Breakfast
When going on a trip to Hawaii, there are naturally many things one will want to see and experience and Hawaii has lots of great options available.
		If you live in a mostly urban area, then Hawaii can be a great choice for escaping the hustle and bustle of everyday life.
		One such way to escape is in a Hawaiian spa.  Why not drop by a spa after having a meal at Cafe Kaila?
What is a spa?
Spas can be pictured differently all over the world.  For instance, in Japan a lot of people think buildings with hot springs or large baths.
		However, Hawaii's not like that.  The aim of the spas in Hawaii is relaxation, natural healing to help with the shoulders or back, 
		and helping to alleviate illnesses caused by stress, among other things.
Spa Services
●Massage
Treatment, aromatherapy, reflexology, and many other things are associated with massages.
		In Hawaii, the traditional "Lomi Lomi" is very popular. It means "Push and Press" in Hawaiian and has been continually practiced for a long time.
●Steam Sauna
The sauna is great for rejuvenating one's cells and ridding the body of waste.
		Steam helps promote blood circulation and moisturizes the skin making for one great experience.
●Hot Stone
Maybe not so well known is hot stone which involves placing several heated stones on the back.
		It's said the effect of the far infrared rays goes deep to the body's core providing relief to the shoulders, back, and alleviating cold sensations.
●Foot Bath
Foot baths are great for relieving fatigue and cold sensations, but also great for increasing circulation to help rid the body of toxins and up its metabolism.
		They also help with swelling and fatigue in the legs.
●Wrap Scrub Pack
This process is done using a cream or gel made with the natural salts and seaweed found in Hawaii and provides an exfoliating and moisturizing effect.
		The cream also has an aroma therapeutic effect allowing one to relax through the whole treatment.
Fun in Hawaii
If you're visiting Hawaii, these are just some of the many fun things you can do while you're here.
Taking Photos
Hawaii is definitely one of the most picturesque places you can go to!
		From beautiful scenery to wonderful places, you photographers out there will have to give Hawaii a visit sometime.
Shopping
There are lots of things that you can only get in Hawaii.
		Hawaii limited items also make great souvenirs.
		Be sure to check out all the neat Hawaii exclusives.
The Ocean View
Hawaii's got a great view of the ocean. 
		On Oahu, getting a perfect photo of Diamond Head with Waikiki in the background and enjoy other activities in the water like swimming, surfing, and more!
		Maybe you'll even get to see a sea turtle.
Great Food
There are plenty of great things to eat in Hawaii such as pancakes, hamburgers, steaks, acai, garlic shrimp, and more.
		Also, if Japanese food is your thing, there are plenty of places where you can get udon, sushi, and other delicacies.
Trekking
Trekking is another thing to do in Hawaii.
		It's different from mountain climbing as the goal isn't to reach the mountain summit, but rather to simply enjoy the scenery.
		The area around Diamond Head makes for a great trekking experience, but there are lots of great places to do it.
Yoga
Hawaii's surrounded by nature, and in it yoga is something you should try.
		Feel the nature in your whole body as it heals from the stress of everyday life.
		Some yoga sessions are even offered by the ocean.
Fun Activities to Do
In Hawaii
There are countless things to do and enjoy in Hawaii such from sightseeing and shopping to enjoying good pancakes.
		But there's more than just the basiscs.  You can also enjoy the jungle, horseback riding, and more.
		This page will talk about some things you can do in Hawaii with your friends and family.
Kualoa Ranch
This place was actually one of the locations in the hit film "Jurassic Park".  Here, you can enjoy horseback riding as well as the wilderness not to mention the vast ranch area.
		From time to time you'll also get to enjoy a nice, refreshing Hawaiian breeze.
If you can't ride a horse, don't worry as the people here are very welcoming to newcomers.  Children can even try it out.
In addition to riding, there are plenty of other activities to do such as taking a bus tour and a Kaneohe Bay cruise.
Information
Address: 49-560 Kamehameha Hwy
Kaneohe, HI 96744
Diamond Head Trail
Despite being the symbol of Hawaii, Diamond Head is surprisingly not climbed by as as many people as one would thing.
		The top has an altitude of 232 meters and a 1.3 km hiking course.
You can get a wonderful 360 view of Waikiki from the top.
Information
Address: 4200 Diamond Head Road
Honolulu, HI 96816
Atlantis Submarines
The Hawaiian sea is great to see, but it's even greater to see while out in the water itself.
		You don't have to go diving, but can rather ride the Atlantis submarines, which are the only tourist submersibles in Hawaii.
From down in the water you can get a view of Hawaii's sea turtles and colorful fish.
		This is growing more and more in popularity.
Information
Address: 2005 Kalia Road
Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815
Skydive Hawaii
If you want to enjoy everything Hawaii has to offer all at once, you can do it from the sky.
		It's easy for anyone to experience sky diving from the veteran instructors.
Some people may be afraid to try this, but if you can overcome your fears then you'll get to experience some of the best minutes of your life ever.
On clear days, you can see not only Oahu, but also Hawaii and Maui as well.  Sometimes even whales coming close to the coast.
Leave it to the photographers to take your pictures of this unforgettable experience.
Information
Address: 68-760 Farrington Hwy
Ste 1 Waialua, HI 96791

name: Mahina & Sun's
raw_text:
Mahina & Sun’s | Local Flavors & Live Vibes in Waikiki
Menu
Find a Table
Good Vibes.
Great Food.
Always Mahina.
VIEW MENU
MAKE A RESERVATION
E Komo Mai
Hawaii’s Vibrant Flavors, Redefined
Welcome to Mahina & Sun’s, your home away from home.
Taste Hawaii, Stay for the Vibes
MORE THAN JUST A MEAL
Hidden within a swell little spot called the SURFJACK HOTEL & SWIM CLUB, Mahina & Sun’s will become your second home. In Hawaiian, “Mahina” means moon—a celestial counterpart to the sun, both essential to traditional Hawaiian sailing navigation. A visit to Mahina & Sun’s is more than just a meal; it’s a gathering place for adventurers, a hub for meaningful connections, and a spark for creative ideas—all mapped out over vibrant local cuisine and generous pours.
The bar program at Mahina & Sun’s, recognized as one of HAWAI’I Magazine’s ‘Top 5 Bars in Hawaii,’ is helmed by New York Native, Bar Czar Christian Taibi. Christian crafts signature cocktails using fresh, locally sourced ingredients.
Taste Hawaii, Stay for the Vibes
MORE THAN JUST A MEAL
Hidden within a swell little spot called the SURFJACK HOTEL & SWIM CLUB, Mahina & Sun’s will become your second home. In Hawaiian, “Mahina” means moon—a celestial counterpart to the sun, both essential to traditional Hawaiian sailing navigation. A visit to Mahina & Sun’s is more than just a meal; it’s a gathering place for adventurers, a hub for meaningful connections, and a spark for creative ideas—all mapped out over vibrant local cuisine and generous pours.
Chef Erik reimagines Hawaii’s classic comfort foods, offering travelers a unique, unforgettable taste of the islands and locals a nostalgic sense of home.
The bar program at Mahina & Sun’s, recognized as one of HAWAI’I Magazine’s ‘Top 5 Bars in Hawaii,’ is helmed by New York Native, Bar Czar Christian Taibi. Christian crafts signature cocktails using fresh, locally sourced ingredients.
Taste Hawaii, Stay for the Vibes
MORE THAN JUST A MEAL
Hidden within a swell little spot called the SURFJACK HOTEL & SWIM CLUB, Mahina & Sun’s will become your second home. In Hawaiian, “Mahina” means moon—a celestial counterpart to the sun, both essential to traditional Hawaiian sailing navigation. A visit to Mahina & Sun’s is more than just a meal; it’s a gathering place for adventurers, a hub for meaningful connections, and a spark for creative ideas—all mapped out over vibrant local cuisine and generous pours.
The bar program at Mahina & Sun’s, recognized as one of Hawaii Magazine’s ‘Top 5 Bars in Hawaii,’ is helmed by New York Native, Bar Czar Christian Taibi. Christian crafts signature cocktails using fresh, locally sourced ingredients.
MEET OUR TASTEMAKERS
Meet our Bar Czar
BAR CZAR
Christian Taibi
Christian is a true New Yorker. Growing up in an Italian family, he was always surrounded by the most welcoming and loving of friends and it was his family who showed him what is truly means to be a great host.
LEARN MORE
EXECUTIVE CHEF
Erik Leong
Executive Chef Erik Leong brings over 16 years of experience and a deep passion for cooking, inspired by his late mother. His locally rooted approach elevates Hawai‘i’s flavors with heart and creativity.
LEARN MORE
BAR CZAR
Christian Taibi
Christian is a true New Yorker. Growing up in an Italian family, he was always surrounded by the most welcoming and loving of friends and it was his family who showed him what is truly means to be a great host.
LEARN MORE
Savor the Best of Mahina and Sun’s
Signature Dishes & Cocktails
Mahina Family Feast
Whole local fried fish served with Aʻu crudo, kalo, uala, chili pepper water, aioli, fish pickles, sesame bok choy rice, cucumber ume salad, and banana pudding.​
Martini Royale
The coldest martinis in town, paired with a medley of olive caviar.​
Off The Hook
Fresh catch paired with uala purée, asparagus, and lemon butter coconut sauce.​
Green Raja
An elevated gimlet enhanced with flavors of the spice trade, featuring Kupu Gin and homemade lime cordial.​
Fresh Oysters
Served with a spicy mignonette.​
Hanalei Moon
A signature cocktail offering a unique flavor profile.​
Seared Ahi
Accompanied by kalo, uala, pohole, onions, tomato, and chili pepper aioli.​
Santa Poco
A plethora of flavors celebrating a pre-Prohibition classic, featuring a blend of El Siempre Tequilas, Montenegro Amaro, and homemade grenadine.
Aʻu Crudo (Blue Marlin)
Prepared with smoked soy, yuzu, chile, inamona, and limu.​

Pearl City Location Permanently Closed
After proudly serving the community for the past 5 years, we sadly announce the permanent closing of our Pearl City location on 1/2/2025. Our lease ended and, like many local family-owned restaurants, we’ve been faced with labor shortages.
Our hardworking crews at our Kapahulu, Kāneʻohe, and Sand Island food truck locations look forward to serving you.
Mahalo for your patronage and friendship!

See What We’re Serving Up at Our Kaka‘ako Restaurant
Our menu hasn’t changed much since we first opened in 1947, and the reason is pretty simple. Generations have grown up eating, loving and coming back for more. And we’re pretty sure you will, too, once you get a taste of what we’re serving up at our restaurants. Menus vary by location.
Order here for pick up or delivery? Want to download our Menus? Click on the buttons over on the right. Prefer to fax your order to beat the crowds at lunchtime? Download the form, fill out your order and fax it to us at (808) 954-4959.

NAD+ for Anti-Aging 300mg, 500mg, 1000mg
Ingredients:
Normal Saline 0.9% IV fluid, Electrolytes, NAD+ (Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide), B-complex (B1, B2, B3, B5, B6), Hydroxocobalamin (B-12), Ascorbic Acid (Vitamin C), Magnesium Chloride, Calcium Chloride, Glutathione
Key Ingredients and Their Benefits
Priming cells with specific ingredients in NAD+ IV therapy infusion enhances the effectiveness of NAD+ by creating an optimal environment for cellular function and repair. Each ingredient plays a crucial role:
NAD+:
(Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide) As a key player in energy metabolism in every cell of the body, NAD+ helps power cellular processes and promotes mitochondrial function, which is essential for energy production, overall vitality, as well as in various biological processes, including DNA repair and regulation of cellular functions.
Calcium:
By supporting muscle function and nerve signaling, calcium helps ensure that cells communicate effectively and operate optimally, enhancing the overall efficacy of the infusion.
Magnesium:
This mineral is critical for many enzymatic reactions, including those involved in energy production and DNA repair. Magnesium helps reduce stress on cells and supports metabolic processes, allowing NAD+ to work more efficiently.
Vitamin C:
As a powerful antioxidant, Vitamin C protects cells from oxidative stress, which can hinder cellular function and longevity. By neutralizing free radicals, it allows NAD+ to perform its functions without interruption.
B-Complex Vitamins:
These vitamins support energy metabolism and enhance mood, ensuring that cells have the nutrients needed for efficient energy production and overall health, making them more responsive to the effects of NAD+.
Vitamin B-12:
This vitamin is vital for red blood cell formation and neurological health, ensuring that cells receive adequate oxygen and support for optimal function, further amplifying the benefits of NAD+.
Glutathione:
As the body's master antioxidant, glutathione assists in detoxification and reduces inflammation. By protecting cells from damage, it creates a favorable environment for NAD+ to enhance cellular repair and longevity.
By priming cells with these essential ingredients, NAD+ IV therapy can more effectively support energy production, cellular repair, and overall health, promoting longevity and vitality. This synergistic approach enhances the therapeutic effects of NAD+, ensuring that cells are not only energized but also resilient against the stresses of aging and environmental factors.

ORGINIAL MYER’S COCTAIL
Ingredients:
Normal Saline 0.9% IV fluid, Electrolytes, B-complex (B1, B2, B3, B5, B6), Hydroxocobalamin (B-12), Ascorbic Acid (Vitamin C), Magnesium Chloride, Calcium Chloride
Key Ingredients and Their Benefits for Classic Myer's Cocktail
Calcium:
Essential for strong bones and teeth, calcium also supports muscle function and nerve transmission, helping maintain overall bodily functions.
Magnesium:
This mineral promotes muscle relaxation, reduces stress, and improves sleep quality, contributing to overall well-being and recovery.
Vitamin C:
A powerful antioxidant, Vitamin C enhances immune function, supports collagen production for healthy skin, and helps protect the body from oxidative stress.
B-Complex Vitamins:
These vitamins are crucial for energy metabolism, support brain health, and help improve mood, reducing fatigue and promoting vitality.
Vitamin B-12:
Vital for red blood cell formation and neurological function, B-12 boosts energy levels and supports cognitive health, making it essential for overall vitality.
ATHLETIC RECOVERY IV: Optimal Performance x Recovery
Ingredients:
Normal Saline 0.9% IV fluid, Electrolytes, B-complex (B1, B2, B3, B5, B6), Hydroxocobalamin (B-12), Amino Acids, Zinc, Magnesium, Taurine, Glutathione
Key Ingredients and their Benefits:
Amino Acid Blend-
Amino acids are the building blocks of proteins, crucial for muscle repair and growth. They help reduce muscle soreness and promote faster recovery after intense workouts.
Magnesium Chloride-
Magnesium plays a vital role in muscle function, energy production, and reducing cramps. It helps maintain electrolyte balance, promoting overall hydration and muscle relaxation.
B-Complex Vitamins-
B vitamins are essential for energy metabolism, helping convert food into fuel. They support overall endurance and reduce fatigue during workouts, enhancing athletic performance.
Hydroxocobalamin (Vitamin B-12)-
This form of Vitamin B-12 is key for red blood cell production and oxygen transport. Adequate levels improve energy levels and focus, crucial for peak performance.
Taurine-
Taurine supports cardiovascular health and muscle function. It has antioxidant properties and can help reduce muscle damage during intense exercise, aiding recovery.
Zinc-
Zinc is vital for immune function and muscle repair. It supports recovery from exercise-induced stress and helps maintain optimal hormone levels for performance.
Glutathione-
As a powerful antioxidant, glutathione helps combat oxidative stress caused by intense workouts. It promotes faster recovery and enhances overall immune function.
WEIGHT LOSS IV & LIGHT DETOX
Ingredients:
Normal Saline 0.9% IV fluid, Electrolytes, B-complex (B1, B2, B3, B5, B6), Ascorbic Acid (Vitamin C), Hydroxocobalamin (B-12), L-Carnitine, L-Arginine, Zinc, Glutathione
Key Ingredients and Their Benefits:
Vitamin B-Complex:
These vitamins play a crucial role in energy metabolism and help convert food into energy, supporting a healthy metabolism and reducing fatigue during weight loss.
L-Carnitine:
This amino acid is essential for transporting fatty acids into the mitochondria for energy production, helping to enhance fat burning and improve exercise performance.
L-Arginine:
L-Arginine supports fat metabolism by helping the body break down fats for energy, while also promoting muscle growth to preserve lean muscle mass during fat loss. Additionally, it enhances hormone regulation and supports the release of growth hormone, further aiding in fat loss.
Vitamin B-12:
Vital for energy production and the metabolism of fats and carbohydrates, B-12 supports overall vitality and can help reduce feelings of fatigue during weight loss efforts.
Zinc:
Important for regulating metabolism and supporting appetite control, zinc helps optimize metabolic function and can enhance overall weight management.
Vitamin C:
As a powerful antioxidant, Vitamin C supports the immune system and reduces oxidative stress, which can be beneficial during weight loss and overall wellness.
Glutathione:
Known as the body's master antioxidant, glutathione supports detoxification and reduces inflammation, promoting a healthier metabolism and aiding in weight loss.
